name: EDITED
slogan: Right product, right price, right time
description:
Brands like Puma, Topshop and Tommy Hilfiger use EDITED every day to make sure they have the right products, at the right price, at the right time. This is the most important thing to get right in the apparel business, and is how all the value is created or lost in the industry.  Our product is used by buyers, planners and trading teams to generate a huge competitive advantage, and effectively, lets apparel retailers behave more like Amazon, (and use less guessing!).

EDITED retail technology is the industry standard for real-time analytics of pricing, assortment, demand, and competitive metrics. The company was founded in 2009 and has rapidly expanded, with offices in New York, London and San Francisco. Our clients are spread across all continents (except Antarctica!), in countries as diverse as Italy, South Africa, Russia, India, Australia, South Korea, the US & UK, and many more.

Hear our team talk about what it's like to work at EDITED at https://edited.com/jobs/

jobs.title: Business Development Manager
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a sales professional with three or more years’ worth of experience in B2B SaaS sales or in a retail head office. You’re someone who thrives on working in a fast paced scale-up environment, and you get a kick out of closing deals and over exceeding your target.

As a Business Development Manager at EDITED we’ll expect you to build and maintain relationships with potential customers, develop new opportunities through a consultative sales approach, and of course, drive those opportunities through to close; either as part of the team or on your own, depending on the situation. You’ll be managing multiple opportunities at once, so you’ll need to be organised, process driven and diligent to ensure that leads turn into sales.

We build and sell an industry leading product in a trillion dollar industry; perform well and you’ll be rewarded very, very well. However it’ll take ambition, self-motivation and a work ethic that’s equal parts collaborative and independent -- so if those are the words that people use when they describe you, we’d love to chat.

Responsibilities:

* Negotiate and close new deals in order to hit commercial targets.
* Articulate and understand the value of EDITED to world-leading brands and retailers.
* Build professional relationships that become commercial relationships.
* Use your initiative and entrepreneurship to reach your market and develop your pipeline.
* Understand our customers’ roles and pain points thoroughly enough to suggest meaningful solutions.
* Successfully negotiate contracts with clients, working closely with both our own and our customers’ sales management, finance and legal teams.
* Become an accredited expert on the EDITED software and the retail industry in general.
* Forecast your sales pipeline effectively - you’re accountable for your number.
* Follow sales processes, and use sales tools to suggest and share improvements.

You are:

* Someone who likes to win - you’re hungry for sales
* Articulate, clear and concise - people pay attention when you speak
* Considered and confident. You have gravitas when you present and you’re not afraid to engage with customers
* Curious - you’re constantly working to stay informed with new market intelligence and industry news
* Entrepreneurial, independent and self-motivated - you love to get your hands dirty, you’re always eager to learn new things and innovate/improve processes
* KPI and target driven

Helpful:

* You are interested in the fashion and retail industry.

jobs.title: Finance Assistant
jobs.description:
About EDITED

At EDITED we’re helping the world's best retail businesses have the right product, at the right price, at the right time. We're growing rapidly internationally, with our headquarters in London and a further office in New York. Our customers, like Tommy Hilfiger, Puma and Ted Baker use our industry-changing software to understand what's happening in their market. We provide their buyers and merchandisers - the most important commercial people in the business - with a beautiful and easy to use analytics platform, to make critical data-driven decisions, every day. To make this possible we need to ensure that the Retail and Fashion industry is educated in how to use EDITED effectively.

We’re making waves in a trillion-dollar industry. We’re gearing up to be a hundred million revenue company in the next few years, and we’re fast outgrowing all of our finance function. In everything we do, we’re world class, so now it’s time to take a world-class approach to finance.

At EDITED, you’ll be part of our Finance & Operations team, working closely with the broader team to support the day to day running of the business. The Finance Assistant will be at the heart of our growth strategy - you will manage the vital day to day as we grow at lightning speed. We've got huge scope to innovate and we always welcome fresh perspectives. You'll be able to make a big impact, and learn a huge amount during your time at EDITED. We’ve got a strategic plan to be a billion-dollar revenue company, and if you think you’ve got the skills and guts to drive the details to get us there then this is the job for you!

As a rule, we operate as peers among equals. We’re given the freedom and trust to solve big problems, and collaborate on bringing about the best solutions. Getting sh*t done together, and having a good time, are the cornerstones of what it means to work at EDITED.

The Job

As a finance assistant, you'll be involved in managing sales and purchase ledgers, reconciliation of bank and credit card accounts, running payroll, processing expense claims, filing and maintaining records, maintaining the fixed asset register and petty cash. The role would involve carrying out the tasks for the parent company based in London as well as for its US subsidiary. This role is ideal for someone who is at an early stage in their accounts career or possibly someone returning to work, as on-the-job training will be provided as part of the induction to familiarise you with relevant systems.

Requirements

Essential:

* Strong understanding of accountancy and bookkeeping
* Minimum one year work experience in similar position
* Working towards professional qualification in accountancy or bookkeeping from accredited institutions like AAT, IAB or similar
* Excellent use of Excel
* An organised, methodical and proactive approach
* Excellent attention to detail and the ability to work to deadline

Desirable:

* Experience with Xero and Kashflow payroll software
* Able to prepare accounts to trial balance

jobs.title: Front End Engineer
jobs.description:
Front End Engineer

At EDITED, you'll be part of our Product and Data team, working closely with other software developers and data scientists, retail specialists and designers to create data-driven solutions to our customers' problems. We've got huge scope to innovate and we always welcome fresh perspectives. You'll be able to make a big impact, and learn a huge amount during your time at EDITED.

We bring in the best candidates to meet our existing team and get to know them before making a hiring decision together.

As a Front End Engineer, you'll be involved in the building of new product features from scratch, optimising front end performance, fixing any issues or bugs and working alongside the product and design team to create an amazing user experience for our customers.

You have a strong computer science background and a love for building web applications consisting of more than just HTML and CSS and have actually built a few in your time. Our web app is primarily built using the latest web technologies like React and Redux, so expect to dive straight into those.

We are also looking to grow the team further in the near future, so you’ll also be able to get involved with on-boarding and mentoring more junior members of the team.

Essential:

* Previous experience in a Front End developer role.
* Experience building JavaScript applications with ReactJS.
* Experience working closely with a design team to develop high quality customer facing interfaces.
* Experience resolving technical issues and communicating those directly to internal and external stakeholders.
* Deep knowledge of Javascript, HTML and CSS.
* You have experience with modern software development practices like reviewing code via pull requests, writing tests and following a continuous integration/deployment methodology.
* Ability to ship things fast. We move fast and deploy quite a few times every day.

* Experience with ES6, React, Redux, Webpack.
* An interest in data visualisation.
* Strong sense of good engineering and architecture.

Helpful:

* University level degree in Computer Science or similar.
* Open source contributions.

Perks:

* Flexible working hours.
* Visiting the U.S? You’re welcome to work out of our New York or San Francisco office.
* 25 days holiday + public holidays + 1 additional day holiday for every year you’ve worked at EDITED.
* Quarterly hack days.
* Stock options.
* In-house wellbeing coach.
* Fully stocked office drinks fridge.
* Monthly team lunches.

jobs.title: Retail Strategist
jobs.description:
Retail Strategists at EDITED work closely with our high profile customers, helping them understand our product and seamlessly integrating the tool into their working practices.

You’ll be a true product expert with a genuine passion for the retail industry and helping it evolve. You’ll understand all features and methodology, using this understanding to create use cases for our diverse set of users. Your intrinsic understanding of apparel planning means you can build and deliver best-in-class training across all our clients.

Our Retail Strategists get the best of both worlds - working closely with the world’s best brands and retailers and also advocating for them internally. You’ll have a strong advisory relationship with our Product Team to advise them of challenges within the industry that our software can help solve.


Our expectations for your position:

* You’re fanatical about supporting customers, take responsibility for them using and understanding the product, and have a personal connection to them.
* You can be a strong advocate for our products, and understand existing processes within retailers and brands.
* You have exceptional verbal and written communication skills and you are able to communicate across time zones and all types of people in all sorts of roles.
* You are tech savvy and able to communicate feedback and feature requests back to the product teams at EDITED.
* You are organized and meticulous about documenting processes.
* You’re able to articulate positioning, use cases and benefits.
* You are numerate, and data literate, and know how to identify trends in client usage and use these trends to build and deliver training to increase product adoption.
* You will build and deliver best in class training to our clients by understanding their job roles, client success measures, and adult learning best practices.
* Able to identify warning signs and opportunities across the client base. Works collaboratively with Account Management counterparts to find a way forward.

Requirements:

* 2+ years corporate retail head office experience.
* Proven success in exceeding targets and key competencies.
* Technical competence and enthusiasm.
* Excellent written, communication and presentation skills.
* Thrives in a team environment.
* Independent thinker - not afraid to try new things.
* Highly organised and tenacious.

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.description:
A lot of retailers need help with their business, and don't always get things right. In this job, you'll be a big part of helping them solve their problems.

Not everyone is using EDITED yet, so in this job you need to be business minded, as you'll need to ask the right questions, understand how their business works, and how to integrate EDITED into their every day. You'll also be responsible for explaining and demoing the EDITED product to retail professionals from potential customers (from junior to senior C-level employees), explaining both how to use our product from a value perspective, and the best way to retail in 2019.

It's an opportunity to make a difference to some big organisations and a huge industry. You’ll learn everything there is to know about sales, prospecting and the most important parts of retailing, which is going to be the beginning of a great step up in your sales career.

Responsibilities

*  Identify new opportunities and quality potential leads
*  Run a smooth process with both inbound and outbound leads, from initial outreach via phone and email, to the qualification of those opportunities
*  Giving engaging demos to retail professionals, in order to educate and excite prospects about EDITED

Requirements

You are:
*  Someone who likes to win - You’re hungry for sales
*  Articulate, clear and concise - people pay attention when you speak
*  Considered and confident. You have gravitas when you present and you’re not afraid to engage with prospects
*  Entrepreneurial, independent and self-motivated - you love to get your hands dirty
*  KPI and target driven
*  Interested in starting a career in sales - this is a great foot in the door and you’re excited to progress to one day closing deals.
*  Someone who loves problem solving and innovating
*  A person that gets things done
*  A super fast learner

Essential skills:
*  You're great at writing
*  A real reader, you love business books and keeping up-to-date with blogs
*  You're a great researcher, an expert on SEO’s, and love digging up information
*  You are persistent, patient, don't get discouraged, and when you meet or speak to difficult people you can brush it off and get back on your A-game

Helpful:
*  You're passionate about retail, or fashion, or both!
*  You love business

Benefits

*  Flexible working
*  Visiting London? You’re welcome to work out of our office
*  25 days of paid time off + 8 public holidays + 1 additional day of paid time off for every year you’ve worked at EDITED
*  Fully stocked office drinks fridge
*  Monthly team lunches

A lot of retailers need help with their business and don't always get things right. Not everyone is using EDITED yet, so in this job you need to be business minded, because you need to ask the right questions, understand how their business works, and how to integrate EDITED into their every day.

You'll be responsible for reaching out and booking meetings with Senior Director and C-level executives and working closely with the Business Development Managers to support a smooth sales process.

You’ll be explaining how to use our product from a value perspective and also showing retailers the best way to trade in 2019.

You’ll learn everything there is to know about sales, prospecting and the most important parts of retailing, which is going to be the beginning of a great step up in your sales career.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify new opportunities and to qualify potential leads
  • Run a smooth process with both inbound and outbound leads, from initial outreach via phone, email or LinkedIn, to the qualification of these opportunities

Requirements

You are:

  • Someone who likes to win - you’re hungry to learn sales
  • Articulate, clear and concise - people pay attention when you speak
  • Considered and confident. You’re not afraid to engage with prospects
  • Entrepreneurial, independent and self-motivated - you love to get your hands dirty
  • KPI and target driven
  • Interested in starting a career in sales - this is a great foot in the door and you’re excited to progress to one day closing deals
  • Someone who loves problem-solving and innovating
  • A person that gets things done
  • A super fast learner

Essential skills:

  • You have great attention to detail
  • You have strong admin and writing skills
  • You’re aware of what’s going on around you - you love reading business books and keeping up-to-date with blogs and podcasts
  • You're a great researcher, inquisitive and you love digging up information
  • You are persistent, patient, don't get discouraged and, when you meet or speak to difficult people, you can brush it off and get back on your A-game

This will be your opportunity to make a difference to, and to work with, some of the largest organisations in a huge industry. EDITED already boasts some of the finest partners, such as Topshop, Puma and Tommy Hilfiger. Your role will have an immediate impact on more companies like these and will build upon an already amazing partner list.
